lead_paragraph: The city’s overburdened public defender system was right to stop taking new cases until the government provides proper funding.
snippet: The city’s overburdened public defender system was right to stop taking new cases until the government provides proper funding.

headline.main: A Waiting List for Justice in New Orleans
headline.print_headline: A Waiting List for Justice in New Orleans

abstract: Editorial highlights fact that New Orleans Public Defenders Office, due to lack of funding, has been forced to turn down case of Deonca Kennedy, charged with negligent homicide for accidental shooting of her 3-year-old grandson; notes underfunded public defense systems are national problem nationwide, but particularly onerous in New Orleans, as primary revenue for public defense comes from court fees for transgressions like traffic violations; calls on Louisiana lawmakers to sufficiently fund system.
